dxf2svg.util
Class Database

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.util.Database
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FigureSheetDatabase
public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is a simple database that could incorporate numerous tables, each with a number of records. Records are made up of a primary key (String value) and the record data itself which is stored in the form of String arrays (String[]).

Because the underlying structure is a Hashtable, adding a record that duplicates another will result in the first record being over written.

A typical application is the FigureSheetDatabase which stores all of a publication's figures as individual tables; each of these tables stores the sheet number as a key and a Vector of spotcall titles etc as the value.

Version:
0.01 - November 13, 2003
Author:
Andrew Nisbet
See Also:

Method Detail

createRecord

public boolean createRecord(java.lang.String tableName,
                            java.lang.String key,
                            java.util.Vector values)
Creates a new record on the argument table.

Parameters:
tableName - of the table within the database.
key - Key String for the new record.
values - Vector of values to be stored in record.
Returns:
true if the database has the requested table and the record is created in that table successfully.
Throws:
Database.NullDatabaseObjectException - if the table name or key are null.

keySet

public java.util.Set keySet()
Returns a Set of the names of stored objects.

getRecord

public java.util.Vector getRecord(java.lang.String tableName,
                                  java.lang.String key)
This method returns the values stored in a table called tableName by reference of the key argument.

Returns:
Vector of values stored, or alternatively null if the table or record does not exist in the database.
Throws:
Database.NullDatabaseObjectException - if the table name or key are null.

getTable

public java.util.Hashtable getTable(java.lang.String tableName)
This method returns a Hashtable table with the name of the argument 'tableName'. The Hashtable includes entries listed by sheet number as a key and Vector of records as the value where boardnos, spotcalls, titles and the like are stored.

delete

public boolean delete(java.lang.String tableName,
                      java.lang.String key)
Deletes a record (named key) from the table 'tableName'.

delete

public boolean delete(java.lang.String tableName)
Deletes an entire table (tableName).

get

protected java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object name)
Returns the object by the key of name.

getTableAndRecord

public java.lang.String[] getTableAndRecord(java.lang.String value)
This method returns an array of strings in which the first value is the name of the table and the second is the name of the key for any supplied value. Both could be null if the key could not be found in any table.

Returns:
String[] where element 0 is the name of the table, and element 1 is the name of the primary key record name that contains the argument 'value'.
Throws:
Database.NullDatabaseObjectException - if the value argument is a null String.

containsKey

public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
This method returns true if the requested key was found in the database false otherwise.
